column4: Ok, so I just installed 8.04, and I got it to boot up, and install 2 updates.... then I installed one of the restricted drivers for my video card, and when i go to reboot the computer, it just goes to a black screen instead of the logon screen. Any advice anyone?
- what video card?
ah shoot, hold on. I think it's an ATI Radeon x1950, but let me double check
yeah, ATI Radeon x1950 Pro
go to ATI site, and find what cards the 8.4 driver supports
ok, hold on.
--- wait
what's up
----- some ppl with ATI are having difficulty with Restricted drivers enabled
any way i can disable it, without having to reinstall ubuntu?
except you can't get into the desktop
yeah, but i'm sure i can get to a full screen terminal, no?
- now yer on to it
a round about way.. is xorg.conf.. in /etc
yeah, i know, but how do i get to a full screen terminal? last time i just had to press shift and backspace or something similar
--- fglrx might not even work.. but the generic system drivers will let you run Compiz
ok, i just need to find a way to get to the terminal lol
--- got that far, good go
- also see #compiz-Fusion
----- follow along what crdlb  is doing, but don't do it..
thanks
- copy xorg.conf - as backup
yeah i wish i did that before the restricted drivers
thanks, hopefully this new method works. we'll see. i'd just like to replace windows and have a better performing desktop.
